properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the AS configuration. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new AS configuration.

properties.name: scaling_configuration_name
properties.description: • scaling_configuration_name - (Required) The name of the AS configuration. The name can contain letters, digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-), and cannot exceed 64 characters.

properties.name: instance_config
properties.description: • instance_config - (Required) The information about instance configurations. The instance_config dictionary data structure is documented below.
The instance_config block supports:

properties.name: instance_id
properties.description: • instance_id - (Optional) When using the existing instance specifications as the template to create AS configurations, specify this argument. In this case, flavor, image, and disk arguments do not take effect. If the instance_id argument is not specified, flavor, image, and disk arguments are mandatory.

properties.name: flavor
properties.description: • flavor - (Optional) The flavor ID.

properties.name: image
properties.description: • image - (Optional) The image ID.

properties.name: disk
properties.description: • disk - (Optional) The disk group information. System disks are mandatory and data disks are optional. The dick structure is described below.

properties.name: key_name
properties.description: • key_name - (Required) The name of the SSH key pair used to log in to the instance.

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: • user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance. The file content must be encoded with Base64.

properties.name: personality
properties.description: • personality - (Optional) Customize the personality of an instance by defining one or more files and their contents. The personality structure is described below.

properties.name: public_ip
properties.description: • public_ip - (Optional) The elastic IP address of the instance. The public_ip structure is described below.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from within the instance.
The disk block supports:

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The disk size. The unit is GB. The system disk size ranges from 40 to 32768, and the data disk size ranges from 10 to 32768.

properties.name: volume_type
properties.description: • volume_type - (Required) The disk type, which must be the same as the disk type available in the system. The options include SATA (common I/O disk type) and SSD (ultra-high I/O disk type).

properties.name: disk_type
properties.description: • disk_type - (Required) Whether the disk is a system disk or a data disk. Option DATA indicates a data disk. option SYS indicates a system disk.
The personality block supports:

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) The absolute path of the destination file.

properties.name: contents
properties.description: • contents - (Required) The content of the injected file, which must be encoded with base64.
The public_ip block supports:

properties.name: eip
properties.description: (Required) The configuration parameter for creating an elastic IP address that will be automatically assigned to the instance. The eip structure is described below.
The eip block supports:

properties.name: ip_type
properties.description: • ip_type - (Required) The IP address type. The system only supports 5_bgp (indicates dynamic BGP).

properties.name: bandwidth
properties.description: • bandwidth - (Required) The bandwidth information. The structure is described below.
The bandwidth block supports:

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The bandwidth (Mbit/s). The value range is 1 to 300.

properties.name: share_type
properties.description: • share_type - (Required) The bandwidth sharing type. The system only supports PER (indicates exclusive bandwidth).

properties.name: charging_mode
properties.description: • charging_mode - (Required) The bandwidth charging mode. The system only supports traffic.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the AS group. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new AS group.

properties.name: scaling_group_name
properties.description: • scaling_group_name - (Required) The name of the scaling group. The name can contain letters, digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-),and cannot exceed 64 characters.

properties.name: scaling_configuration_id
properties.description: • scaling_configuration_id - (Optional) The configuration ID which defines configurations of instances in the AS group.

properties.name: desire_instance_number
properties.description: • desire_instance_number - (Optional) The expected number of instances. The default value is the minimum number of instances. The value ranges from the minimum number of instances to the maximum number of instances.

properties.name: min_instance_number
properties.description: • min_instance_number - (Optional) The minimum number of instances. The default value is 0.

properties.name: max_instance_number
properties.description: • max_instance_number - (Optional) The maximum number of instances. The default value is 0.

properties.name: cool_down_time
properties.description: • cool_down_time - (Optional) The cooling duration (in seconds). The value ranges from 0 to 86400, and is 900 by default.

properties.name: lb_listener_id
properties.description: • lb_listener_id - (Optional) The ELB listener IDs. The system supports up to three ELB listeners, the IDs of which are separated using a comma (,).

properties.name: available_zones
properties.description: • available_zones - (Optional) The availability zones in which to create the instances in the autoscaling group.

properties.name: networks
properties.description: • networks - (Required) An array of one or more network IDs. The system supports up to five networks. The networks object structure is documented below.

properties.name: security_groups
properties.description: • security_groups - (Required) An array of one or more security group IDs to associate with the group. The security_groups object structure is documented below.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) The VPC ID. Changing this creates a new group.

properties.name: health_periodic_audit_method
properties.description: • health_periodic_audit_method - (Optional) The health check method for instances in the AS group. The health check methods include ELB_AUDIT and NOVA_AUDIT. If load balancing is configured, the default value of this parameter is ELB_AUDIT. Otherwise, the default value is NOVA_AUDIT.

properties.name: health_periodic_audit_time
properties.description: • health_periodic_audit_time - (Optional) The health check period for instances. The period has four options: 5 minutes (default), 15 minutes, 60 minutes, and 180 minutes.

properties.name: instance_terminate_policy
properties.description: • instance_terminate_policy - (Optional) The instance removal policy. The policy has four options: OLD_CONFIG_OLD_INSTANCE (default), OLD_CONFIG_NEW_INSTANCE, OLD_INSTANCE, and NEW_INSTANCE.

properties.name: notifications
properties.description: • notifications - (Optional) The notification mode. The system only supports EMAIL mode which refers to notification by email.

properties.name: delete_publicip
properties.description: • delete_publicip - (Optional) Whether to delete the elastic IP address bound to the instances of AS group when deleting the instances. The options are true and false.

properties.name: delete_instances
properties.description: • delete_instances - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group when deleting the AS group. The options are yes and no.
The networks block supports:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) The network UUID.
The security_groups block supports:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) The UUID of the security group.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the AS policy. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new AS policy.

properties.name: scaling_policy_name
properties.description: • scaling_policy_name - (Required) The name of the AS policy. The name can contain letters, digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-),and cannot exceed 64 characters.

properties.name: scaling_group_id
properties.description: • scaling_group_id - (Required) The AS group ID. Changing this creates a new AS policy.

properties.name: scaling_policy_type
properties.description: • scaling_policy_type - (Required) The AS policy type. The values can be ALARM, SCHEDULED, and RECURRENCE.

properties.name: alarm_id
properties.description: • alarm_id - (Optional) The alarm rule ID. This argument is mandatory when scaling_policy_type is set to ALARM.

properties.name: scheduled_policy
properties.description: • scheduled_policy - (Optional) The periodic or scheduled AS policy. This argument is mandatory when scaling_policy_type is set to SCHEDULED or RECURRENCE. The scheduled_policy structure is documented below.

properties.name: scaling_policy_action
properties.description: • scaling_policy_action - (Optional) The action of the AS policy. The scaling_policy_action structure is documented below.

properties.name: cool_down_time
properties.description: • cool_down_time - (Optional) The cooling duration (in seconds), and is 900 by default.
The scheduled_policy block supports:

properties.name: launch_time
properties.description: • launch_time - (Required) The time when the scaling action is triggered. If scaling_policy_type is set to SCHEDULED, the time format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ. If scaling_policy_type is set to RECURRENCE, the time format is hh:mm.

properties.name: recurrence_type
properties.description: • recurrence_type - (Optional) The periodic triggering type. This argument is mandatory when scaling_policy_type is set to RECURRENCE. The options include Daily, Weekly, and Monthly.

properties.name: recurrence_value
properties.description: • recurrence_value - (Optional) The frequency at which scaling actions are triggered.

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: • start_time - (Optional) The start time of the scaling action triggered periodically. The time format complies with UTC. The current time is used by default. The time format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ.

properties.name: end_time
properties.description: • end_time - (Optional) The end time of the scaling action triggered periodically. The time format complies with UTC. This argument is mandatory when scaling_policy_type is set to RECURRENCE. The time format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ.
The scaling_policy_action block supports:

properties.name: operation
properties.description: • operation - (Optional) The operation to be performed. The options include ADD (default), REMOVE, and SET.

properties.name: instance_number
properties.description: • instance_number - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the volume. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Optional) The availability zone for the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: consistency_group_id
properties.description: • consistency_group_id - (Optional) The consistency group to place the volume in.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the volume. Changing this updates the volume's description.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Optional) The image ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to associate with the volume. Changing this updates the existing volume metadata.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the volume. Changing this updates the volume's name.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: • snapshot_id - (Optional) The snapshot ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: source_replica
properties.description: • source_replica - (Optional) The volume ID to replicate with.

properties.name: source_vol_id
properties.description: • source_vol_id - (Optional) The volume ID from which to create the volume. Changing this creates a new volume.

properties.name: volume_type
properties.description: • volume_type - (Optional) The type of volume to create. Changing this creates a new volume.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. A Compute client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with a compute instance. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which may or may not have a different address).

properties.name: pool
properties.description: • pool - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. Keypairs are associated with accounts, but a Compute client is needed to create one. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new floatingip_associate.

properties.name: floating_ip
properties.description: • floating_ip - (Required) The floating IP to associate.

properties.name: instance_id
properties.description: • instance_id - (Required) The instance to associte the floating IP with.

properties.name: fixed_ip
properties.description: • fixed_ip - (Optional) The specific IP address to direct traffic to.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the server instance. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the resource.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Optional; Required if image_name is empty and not booting from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The image ID of the desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: image_name
properties.description: • image_name - (Optional; Required if image_id is empty and not booting from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The name of the desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: flavor_id
properties.description: • flavor_id - (Optional; Required if flavor_name is empty) The flavor ID of the desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.

properties.name: flavor_name
properties.description: • flavor_name - (Optional; Required if flavor_id is empty) The name of the desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: • user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: security_groups
properties.description: • security_groups - (Optional) An array of one or more security group names to associate with the server. Changing this results in adding/removing security groups from the existing server. Note: When attaching the instance to networks using Ports, place the security groups on the Port and not the instance.

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: • availability_zone - (Optional) The availability zone in which to create the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: network
properties.description: • network - (Optional) An array of one or more networks to attach to the instance. The network object structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from within the instance. Changing this updates the existing server metadata.

properties.name: config_drive
properties.description: • config_drive - (Optional) Whether to use the config_drive feature to configure the instance. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: admin_pass
properties.description: • admin_pass - (Optional) The administrative password to assign to the server. Changing this changes the root password on the existing server.

properties.name: key_pair
properties.description: • key_pair - (Optional) The name of a key pair to put on the server. The key pair must already be created and associated with the tenant's account. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: block_device
properties.description: • block_device - (Optional) Configuration of block devices. The block_device structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new server. You can specify multiple block devices which will create an instance with multiple disks. This configuration is very flexible, so please see the following reference for more information.

properties.name: scheduler_hints
properties.description: • scheduler_hints - (Optional) Provide the Nova scheduler with hints on how the instance should be launched. The available hints are described below.

properties.name: personality
properties.description: • personality - (Optional) Customize the personality of an instance by defining one or more files and their contents. The personality structure is described below.

properties.name: stop_before_destroy
properties.description: • stop_before_destroy - (Optional) Whether to try stop instance gracefully before destroying it, thus giving chance for guest OS daemons to stop correctly. If instance doesn't stop within timeout, it will be destroyed anyway.
The network block supports:

properties.name: uuid
properties.description: • uuid - (Required unless port or name is provided) The network UUID to attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required unless uuid or port is provided) The human-readable name of the network. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required unless uuid or name is provided) The port UUID of a network to attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: fixed_ip_v4
properties.description: • fixed_ip_v4 - (Optional) Specifies a fixed IPv4 address to be used on this network. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: fixed_ip_v6
properties.description: • fixed_ip_v6 - (Optional) Specifies a fixed IPv6 address to be used on this network. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: access_network
properties.description: • access_network - (Optional) Specifies if this network should be used for provisioning access. Accepts true or false. Defaults to false.
The block_device block supports:

properties.name: uuid
properties.description: • uuid - (Required unless source_type is set to "blank" ) The UUID of the image, volume, or snapshot. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: source_type
properties.description: • source_type - (Required) The source type of the device. Must be one of "blank", "image", "volume", or "snapshot". Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: volume_size
properties.description: • volume_size - The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). Required in the following combinations: source=image and destination=volume, source=blank and destination=local, and source=blank and destination=volume. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: boot_index
properties.description: • boot_index - (Optional) The boot index of the volume. It defaults to 0. Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: destination_type
properties.description: • destination_type - (Optional) The type that gets created. Possible values are "volume" and "local". Changing this creates a new server.

properties.name: delete_on_termination
properties.description: • delete_on_termination - (Optional) Delete the volume / block device upon termination of the instance. Defaults to false. Changing this creates a new server.
The scheduler_hints block supports:

properties.name: group
properties.description: • group - (Optional) A UUID of a Server Group. The instance will be placed into that group.

properties.name: different_host
properties.description: • different_host - (Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will be scheduled on a different host than all other instances.

properties.name: same_host
properties.description: • same_host - (Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will be scheduled on the same host of those specified.

properties.name: query
properties.description: • query - (Optional) A conditional query that a compute node must pass in order to host an instance.

properties.name: target_cell
properties.description: • target_cell - (Optional) The name of a cell to host the instance.

properties.name: build_near_host_ip
properties.description: • build_near_host_ip - (Optional) An IP Address in CIDR form. The instance will be placed on a compute node that is in the same subnet.
The personality block supports:

properties.name: file
properties.description: • file - (Required) The absolute path of the destination file.

properties.name: contents
properties.description: • contents - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. Keypairs are associated with accounts, but a Compute client is needed to create one. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new keypair.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the keypair. Changing this creates a new keypair.

properties.name: public_key
properties.description: • public_key - (Required) A pregenerated OpenSSH-formatted public key. Changing this creates a new keypair.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. A Compute client is needed to create a security group. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new security group.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the security group. Changing this updates the name of an existing security group.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) A description for the security group. Changing this updates the description of an existing security group.

properties.name: rule
properties.description: • rule - (Optional) A rule describing how the security group operates. The rule object structure is documented below. Changing this updates the security group rules. As shown in the example above, multiple rule blocks may be used.
The rule block supports:

properties.name: from_port
properties.description: • from_port - (Required) An integer representing the lower bound of the port range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: to_port
properties.description: • to_port - (Required) An integer representing the upper bound of the port range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: ip_protocol
properties.description: • ip_protocol - (Required) The protocol type that will be allowed. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: cidr
properties.description: • cidr - (Optional) Required if from_group_id or self is empty. The IP range that will be the source of network traffic to the security group. Use 0.0.0.0/0 to allow all IP addresses. Changing this creates a new security group rule. Cannot be combined with from_group_id or self.

properties.name: from_group_id
properties.description: • from_group_id - (Optional) Required if cidr or self is empty. The ID of a group from which to forward traffic to the parent group. Changing this creates a new security group rule. Cannot be combined with cidr or self.

properties.name: self
properties.description: • self - (Optional) Required if cidr and from_group_id is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with cidr or from_group_id.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new server group.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the server group. Changing this creates a new server group.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Required) The set of policies for the server group. Only two two policies are available right now, and both are mutually exclusive. See the Policies section for more information. Changing this creates a new server group.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.

properties.name: policies-1
properties.description: » Policies

properties.name: affinity
properties.description: • affinity - All instances/servers launched in this group will be hosted on the same compute node.

properties.name: anti-affinity
properties.description: • anti-affinity - All instances/servers launched in this group will be hosted on different compute nodes.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. A Compute client is needed to create a volume attachment. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new volume attachment.

properties.name: instance_id
properties.description: • instance_id - (Required) The ID of the Instance to attach the Volume to.

properties.name: volume_id
properties.description: • volume_id - (Required) The ID of the Volume to attach to an Instance.

properties.name: device
properties.description: • device - (Optional) The device of the volume attachment (ex: /dev/vdc). NOTE: Being able to specify a device is dependent upon the hypervisor in use. There is a chance that the device specified in Terraform will not be the same device the hypervisor chose. If this happens, Terraform will wish to update the device upon subsequent applying which will cause the volume to be detached and reattached indefinitely. Please use with caution.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 DNS client. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new DNS record set.

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: • zone_id - (Required) The ID of the zone in which to create the record set. Changing this creates a new DNS record set.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the record set. Note the . at the end of the name. Changing this creates a new DNS record set.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) The type of record set. Examples: "A", "MX". Changing this creates a new DNS record set.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Optional) The time to live (TTL) of the record set.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the record set.

properties.name: records
properties.description: • records - (Optional) An array of DNS records.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options. Changing this creates a new record set.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client. Keypairs are associated with accounts, but a Compute client is needed to create one. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new DNS zone.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the zone. Note the . at the end of the name. Changing this creates a new DNS zone.

properties.name: email
properties.description: • email - (Optional) The email contact for the zone record.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) The type of zone. Can either be PRIMARY or SECONDARY. Changing this creates a new zone.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: • attributes - (Optional) Attributes for the DNS Service scheduler. Changing this creates a new zone.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Optional) The time to live (TTL) of the zone.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the zone.

properties.name: masters
properties.description: • masters - (Optional) An array of master DNS servers. For when type is SECONDARY.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options. Changing this creates a new zone.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with another networking resource, such as a load balancer. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which may or may not have a different address).

properties.name: pool
properties.description: • pool - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: • port_id - (Optional) ID of an existing port with at least one IP address to associate with this floating IP.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The target tenant ID in which to allocate the floating IP, if you specify this together with a port_id, make sure the target port belongs to the same tenant. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which may or may not have a different address)

properties.name: fixed_ip
properties.description: • fixed_ip - Fixed IP of the port to associate with this floating IP. Required if the port has multiple fixed IPs.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron network. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new network.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the network. Changing this updates the name of the existing network.

properties.name: shared
properties.description: • shared - (Optional) Specifies whether the network resource can be accessed by any tenant or not. Changing this updates the sharing capabalities of the existing network.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the network. Required if admin wants to create a network for another tenant. Changing this creates a new network.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the network. Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value updates the state of the existing network.

properties.name: segments
properties.description: • segments - (Optional) An array of one or more provider segment objects.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The segments block supports:

properties.name: physical_network
properties.description: The phisical network where this network is implemented.

properties.name: segmentation_id
properties.description: An isolated segment on the physical network.

properties.name: network_type
properties.description: The type of physical network.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a port. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the port. Changing this updates the name of an existing port.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) The ID of the network to attach the port to. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) Administrative up/down status for the port (must be "true" or "false" if provided). Changing this updates the admin_state_up of an existing port.

properties.name: mac_address
properties.description: • mac_address - (Optional) Specify a specific MAC address for the port. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the Port. Required if admin wants to create a port for another tenant. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: device_owner
properties.description: • device_owner - (Optional) The device owner of the Port. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: security_group_ids
properties.description: • security_group_ids - (Optional - Conflicts with no_security_groups) A list of security group IDs to apply to the port. The security groups must be specified by ID and not name (as opposed to how they are configured with the Compute Instance).

properties.name: no_security_groups
properties.description: • no_security_groups - (Optional - Conflicts with security_group_ids) If set to true, then no security groups are applied to the port. If set to false and no security_group_ids are specified, then the Port will yield to the default behavior of the Networking service, which is to usually apply the "default" security group.

properties.name: device_id
properties.description: • device_id - (Optional) The ID of the device attached to the port. Changing this creates a new port.

properties.name: fixed_ip
properties.description: • fixed_ip - (Optional) An array of desired IPs for this port. The structure is described below.

properties.name: allowed_address_pairs
properties.description: • allowed_address_pairs - (Optional) An IP/MAC Address pair of additional IP addresses that can be active on this port. The structure is described below.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The fixed_ip block supports:

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Required) Subnet in which to allocate IP address for this port.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Optional) IP address desired in the subnet for this port. If you don't specify ip_address, an available IP address from the specified subnet will be allocated to this port. This field will not be populated if it is left blank. To retrieve the assigned IP address, use the all_fixed_ips attribute.
The allowed_address_pairs block supports:

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Required) The additional IP address.

properties.name: mac_address
properties.description: • mac_address - (Optional) The additional MAC address.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a router. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new router interface.

properties.name: router_id
properties.description: • router_id - (Required) ID of the router this interface belongs to. Changing this creates a new router interface.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - ID of the subnet this interface connects to. Changing this creates a new router interface.

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: • port_id - ID of the port this interface connects to. Changing this creates a new router interface.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to configure a routing entry on a router. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new routing entry.

properties.name: router_id
properties.description: • router_id - (Required) ID of the router this routing entry belongs to. Changing this creates a new routing entry.

properties.name: destination_cidr
properties.description: • destination_cidr - (Required) CIDR block to match on the packet’s destination IP. Changing this creates a new routing entry.

properties.name: next_hop
properties.description: • next_hop - (Required) IP address of the next hop gateway. Changing this creates a new routing entry.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a router. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new router.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A unique name for the router. Changing this updates the name of an existing router.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Optional) Administrative up/down status for the router (must be "true" or "false" if provided). Changing this updates the admin_state_up of an existing router.

properties.name: distributed
properties.description: • distributed - (Optional) Indicates whether or not to create a distributed router. The default policy setting in Neutron restricts usage of this property to administrative users only.

properties.name: external_gateway
properties.description: • external_gateway - (Deprecated - use external_network_id instead) The network UUID of an external gateway for the router. A router with an external gateway is required if any compute instances or load balancers will be using floating IPs. Changing this updates the external gateway of an existing router.

properties.name: external_network_id
properties.description: • external_network_id - (Optional) The network UUID of an external gateway for the router. A router with an external gateway is required if any compute instances or load balancers will be using floating IPs. Changing this updates the external gateway of the router.

properties.name: enable_snat
properties.description: • enable_snat - (Optional) Enable Source NAT for the router. Valid values are "true" or "false". An external_network_id has to be set in order to set this property. Changing this updates the enable_snat of the router.

properties.name: external_fixed_ip
properties.description: • external_fixed_ip - (Optional) An external fixed IP for the router. This can be repeated. The structure is described below. An external_network_id has to be set in order to set this property. Changing this updates the external fixed IPs of the router.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the floating IP. Required if admin wants to create a router for another tenant. Changing this creates a new router.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional driver-specific options.
The external_fixed_ip block supports:

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: • subnet_id - (Optional) Subnet in which the fixed IP belongs to.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Optional) The IP address to set on the router.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client. A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron subnet. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new subnet.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) The UUID of the parent network. Changing this creates a new subnet.

properties.name: cidr
properties.description: • cidr - (Required) CIDR representing IP range for this subnet, based on IP version. Changing this creates a new subnet.

properties.name: ip_version
properties.description: • ip_version - (Optional) IP version, either 4 (default) or 6. Changing this creates a new subnet.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the subnet. Changing this updates the name of the existing subnet.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the subnet. Required if admin wants to create a subnet for another tenant. Changing this creates a new subnet.

properties.name: allocation_pools
properties.description: • allocation_pools - (Optional) An array of sub-ranges of CIDR available for dynamic allocation to ports. The allocation_pool object structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new subnet.

properties.name: gateway_ip
properties.description: • gateway_ip - (Optional) Default gateway used by devices in this subnet. Leaving this blank and not setting no_gateway will cause a default gateway of .1 to be used. Changing this updates the gateway IP of the existing subnet.

properties.name: no_gateway
properties.description: • no_gateway - (Optional) Do not set a gateway IP on this subnet. Changing this removes or adds a default gateway IP of the existing subnet.

properties.name: enable_dhcp
properties.description: • enable_dhcp - (Optional) The administrative state of the network. Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value enables or disables the DHCP capabilities of the existing subnet. Defaults to true.

properties.name: dns_nameservers
properties.description: • dns_nameservers - (Optional) An array of DNS name server names used by hosts in this subnet. Changing this updates the DNS name servers for the existing subnet.

properties.name: host_routes
properties.description: • host_routes - (Optional) An array of routes that should be used by devices with IPs from this subnet (not including local subnet route). The host_route object structure is documented below. Changing this updates the host routes for the existing subnet.

properties.name: value_specs
properties.description: • value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
The allocation_pools block supports:

properties.name: start
properties.description: • start - (Required) The starting address.

properties.name: end
properties.description: • end - (Required) The ending address.
The host_routes block supports:

properties.name: destination_cidr
properties.description: • destination_cidr - (Required) The destination CIDR.

properties.name: next_hop
properties.description: • next_hop - (Required) The next hop in the route.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a port. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new security group.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) A unique name for the security group.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A unique name for the security group.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the security group. Required if admin wants to create a port for another tenant. Changing this creates a new security group.

properties.name: delete_default_rules
properties.description: • delete_default_rules - (Optional) Whether or not to delete the default egress security rules. This is false by default. See the below note for more information.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client. A networking client is needed to create a port. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: • direction - (Required) The direction of the rule, valid values are ingress or egress. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: ethertype
properties.description: • ethertype - (Required) The layer 3 protocol type, valid values are IPv4 or IPv6. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: protocol - (Optional) The layer 4 protocol type, valid values are following. Changing this creates a new security group rule. This is required if you want to specify a port range.
• tcp
• udp
• icmp
• ah
• dccp
• egp
• esp
• gre
• igmp
• ipv6-encap
• ipv6-frag
• ipv6-icmp
• ipv6-nonxt
• ipv6-opts
• ipv6-route
• ospf
• pgm
• rsvp
• sctp
• udplite
• vrrp

properties.name: port_range_min
properties.description: • port_range_min - (Optional) The lower part of the allowed port range, valid integer value needs to be between 1 and 65535. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: port_range_max
properties.description: • port_range_max - (Optional) The higher part of the allowed port range, valid integer value needs to be between 1 and 65535. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: remote_ip_prefix
properties.description: • remote_ip_prefix - (Optional) The remote CIDR, the value needs to be a valid CIDR (i.e. 192.168.0.0/16). Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: remote_group_id
properties.description: • remote_group_id - (Optional) The remote group id, the value needs to be an Openstack ID of a security group in the same tenant. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Required) The security group id the rule should belong to, the value needs to be an Openstack ID of a security group in the same tenant. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the security group. Required if admin wants to create a port for another tenant. Changing this creates a new security group rule.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the load balancer name. The name is a string of 1 to 64 characters that consist of letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Provides supplementary information about the listener. The value is a string of 0 to 128 characters and cannot be <>.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) Specifies the VPC ID.

properties.name: bandwidth
properties.description: • bandwidth - (Optional) Specifies the bandwidth (Mbit/s). This parameter is mandatory when type is set to External, and it is invalid when type is set to Internal. The value ranges from 1 to 300.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Specifies the load balancer type. The value can be Internal or External.

properties.name: admin_state_up
properties.description: • admin_state_up - (Required) Specifies the status of the load balancer. Value range: 0 or false: indicates that the load balancer is stopped. Only tenants are allowed to enter these two values. 1 or true: indicates that the load balancer is running properly. 2 or false: indicates that the load balancer is frozen. Only tenants are allowed to enter these two values.

properties.name: vip_subnet_id
properties.description: • vip_subnet_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the private network to be added. This parameter is mandatory when type is set to Internal, and it is invalid when type is set to External.

properties.name: az
properties.description: • az - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the availability zone (AZ). This parameter is mandatory when type is set to Internal, and it is invalid when type is set to External.

properties.name: charge_mode
properties.description: • charge_mode - (Optional) This is a reserved field. If the system supports charging by traffic and this field is specified, then you are charged by traffic for elastic IP addresses. The value is traffic.

properties.name: eip_type
properties.description: • eip_type - (Optional) This parameter is reserved.

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Optional) Specifies the security group ID. The value is a string of 1 to 200 characters that consists of uppercase and lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens (-). This parameter is mandatory only when type is set to Internal.

properties.name: vip_address
properties.description: • vip_address - (Optional) Specifies the IP address provided by ELB. When typeis set to External, the value of this parameter is the elastic IP address. When type is set to Internal, the value of this parameter is the private network IP address. You can select an existing elastic IP address and create a public network load balancer. When this parameter is configured, parameters bandwidth, charge_mode, and eip_type are invalid.

properties.name: tenantid
properties.description: • tenantid - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory only when type is set to Internal.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the load balancer name. The name is a string of 1 to 64 characters that consist of letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Provides supplementary information about the listener. The value is a string of 0 to 128 characters and cannot be <>.

properties.name: loadbalancer_id
properties.description: • loadbalancer_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the load balancer to which the listener belongs.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) Specifies the listening protocol used for layer 4 or 7. The value can be HTTP, TCP, HTTPS, or UDP.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required) Specifies the listening port. The value ranges from 1 to 65535.

properties.name: backend_protocol
properties.description: • backend_protocol - (Required) Specifies the backend protocol. If the value of protocol is UDP, the value of this parameter can only be UDP. The value can be HTTP, TCP, or UDP.

properties.name: backend_port
properties.description: • backend_port - (Required) Specifies the backend port. The value ranges from 1 to 65535.

properties.name: lb_algorithm
properties.description: • lb_algorithm - (Required) Specifies the load balancing algorithm for the listener. The value can be roundrobin, leastconn, or source.

properties.name: session_sticky
properties.description: • session_sticky - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable sticky session. The value can be true or false. The Sticky session is enabled when the value is true, and is disabled when the value is false. If the value of protocol is HTTP, HTTPS, or TCP, and the value of lb_algorithm is not roundrobin, the value of this parameter can only be false.

properties.name: sticky_session_type
properties.description: • sticky_session_type - (Optional) Specifies the cookie processing method. The value is insert. insert indicates that the cookie is inserted by the load balancer. This parameter is valid when protocol is set to HTTP, and session_sticky to true. The default value is insert. This parameter is invalid when protocol is set to TCP or UDP, which means the parameter is empty.

properties.name: cookie_timeout
properties.description: • cookie_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the cookie timeout period (minutes). This parameter is valid when protocol is set to HTTP, session_sticky to true, and sticky_session_type to insert. This parameter is invalid when protocol is set to TCP or UDP. The value ranges from 1 to 1440.

properties.name: tcp_timeout
properties.description: • tcp_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the TCP timeout period (minutes). This parameter is valid when protocol is set to TCP. The value ranges from 1 to 5.

properties.name: tcp_draining
properties.description: • tcp_draining - (Optional) Specifies whether to maintain the TCP connection to the backend ECS after the ECS is deleted. This parameter is valid when protocol is set to TCP. The value can be true or false.

properties.name: tcp_draining_timeout
properties.description: • tcp_draining_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the timeout duration (minutes) for the TCP connection to the backend ECS after the ECS is deleted. This parameter is valid when protocol is set to TCP, and tcp_draining to true. The value ranges from 0 to 60.

properties.name: certificate_id
properties.description: • certificate_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the SSL certificate used for security authentication when HTTPS is used to make API calls. This parameter is mandatory if the value of protocol is HTTPS. The value can be obtained by viewing the details of the SSL certificate.

properties.name: udp_timeout
properties.description: • udp_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the UDP timeout duration (minutes). This parameter is valid when protocol is set to UDP. The value ranges from 1 to 1440.

properties.name: ssl_protocols
properties.description: • ssl_protocols - (Optional) Specifies the SSL protocol standard supported by a tracker, which is used for enabling specified encryption protocols. This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The value is TLSv1.2 or TLSv1.2 TLSv1.1 TLSv1. The default value is TLSv1.2.

properties.name: ssl_ciphers
properties.description: • ssl_ciphers - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol. This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2 TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: listener_id
properties.description: • listener_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the listener to which the health check task belongs.

properties.name: healthcheck_protocol
properties.description: • healthcheck_protocol - (Optional) Specifies the protocol used for the health check. The value can be HTTP or TCP (case-insensitive).

properties.name: healthcheck_uri
properties.description: • healthcheck_uri - (Optional) Specifies the URI for health check. This parameter is valid when healthcheck_ protocol is HTTP. The value is a string of 1 to 80 characters that must start with a slash (/) and can only contain letters, digits, and special characters, such as -/.%?#&.

properties.name: healthcheck_connect_port
properties.description: • healthcheck_connect_port - (Optional) Specifies the port used for the health check. The value ranges from 1 to 65535.

properties.name: healthy_threshold
properties.description: • healthy_threshold - (Optional) Specifies the threshold at which the health check result is success, that is, the number of consecutive successful health checks when the health check result of the backend server changes from fail to success. The value ranges from 1 to 10.

properties.name: unhealthy_threshold
properties.description: • unhealthy_threshold - (Optional) Specifies the threshold at which the health check result is fail, that is, the number of consecutive failed health checks when the health check result of the backend server changes from success to fail. The value ranges from 1 to 10.

properties.name: healthcheck_timeout
properties.description: • healthcheck_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the maximum timeout duration (s) for the health check. The value ranges from 1 to 50.

properties.name: healthcheck_interval
properties.description: • healthcheck_interval - (Optional) Specifies the maximum interval (s) for health check. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: listener_id
properties.description: • listener_id - (Required) Specifies the listener ID.

properties.name: server_id
properties.description: • server_id - (Required) Specifies the backend member ID.

properties.name: private_address
properties.description: • private_address - (Required) Specifies the private IP address of the backend member.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: alarm_name
properties.description: • alarm_name - (Required) Specifies the name of an alarm rule. The value can be a string of 1 to 128 characters that can consist of numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).

properties.name: alarm_description
properties.description: • alarm_description - (Optional) The value can be a string of 0 to 256 characters.

properties.name: metric
properties.description: • metric - (Required) Specifies the alarm metrics. The structure is described below.

properties.name: condition
properties.description: • condition - (Required) Specifies the alarm triggering condition. The structure is described below.

properties.name: alarm_actions
properties.description: • alarm_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action triggered by an alarm. The structure is described below.

properties.name: insufficientdata_actions
properties.description: • insufficientdata_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action triggered by data insufficiency. The structure is described below.

properties.name: ok_actions
properties.description: • ok_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action triggered by the clearing of an alarm. The structure is described below.

properties.name: alarm_enabled
properties.description: • alarm_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable the alarm. The default value is true.

properties.name: alarm_action_enabled
properties.description: • alarm_action_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable the action to be triggered by an alarm. The default value is true. Note: If alarm_action_enabled is set to true, at least one of the following parameters alarm_actions, insufficientdata_actions, and ok_actions cannot be empty. If alarm_actions, insufficientdata_actions, and ok_actions coexist, their corresponding notification_list must be of the same value.
The metric block supports:

properties.name: namespace
properties.description: • namespace - (Required) Specifies the namespace in service.item format. service.item can be a string of 3 to 32 characters that must start with a letter and can consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, or underscores (_).

properties.name: metric_name
properties.description: • metric_name - (Required) Specifies the metric name. The value can be a string of 1 to 64 characters that must start with a letter and can consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, or underscores (_).

properties.name: dimensions
properties.description: • dimensions - (Required) Specifies the list of metric dimensions. Currently, the maximum length of the dimesion list that are supported is 3. The structure is described below.
The dimensions block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the dimension name. The value can be a string of 1 to 32 characters that must start with a letter and can consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) Specifies the dimension value. The value can be a string of 1 to 64 characters that must start with a letter or a number and can consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
The condition block supports:

properties.name: period
properties.description: • period - (Required) Specifies the alarm checking period in seconds. The value can be 1, 300, 1200, 3600, 14400, and 86400. Note: If period is set to 1, the raw metric data is used to determine whether to generate an alarm.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: • filter - (Required) Specifies the data rollup methods. The value can be max, min, average, sum, and vaiance.

properties.name: comparison_operator
properties.description: • comparison_operator - (Required) Specifies the comparison condition of alarm thresholds. The value can be >, =, <, >=, or <=.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) Specifies the alarm threshold. The value ranges from 0 to Number of 1.7976931348623157e+308.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: • unit - (Optional) Specifies the data unit.

properties.name: count
properties.description: • count - (Required) Specifies the number of consecutive occurrence times. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
the alarm_actions block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the value can be notification or autoscaling. notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user. autoscaling: indicates that a scaling action will be triggered.

properties.name: notification_list
properties.description: • notification_list - (Optional) specifies the topic urn list of the target notification objects. the maximum length is 5. the topic urn list can be obtained from simple message notification (smn) and in the following format: urn: smn:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]|-){1,32}:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]){32}:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]|-|_){1,256}. if type is set to notification, the value of notification_list cannot be empty. if type is set to autoscaling, the value of notification_list must be [] and the value of namespace must be sys.as. Note: to enable the as alarm rules take effect, you must bind scaling policies. for details, see the auto scaling api reference.
the insufficientdata_actions block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the value is notification. notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.

properties.name: notification_list
properties.description: • notification_list - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
the ok_actions block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the value is notification. notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.

properties.name: notification_list
properties.description: • notification_list - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: bucket
properties.description: (Optional, Forces new resource) The name of the bucket. If omitted, Terraform will assign a random, unique name.

properties.name: bucket_prefix
properties.description: (Optional, Forces new resource) Creates a unique bucket name beginning with the specified prefix. Conflicts with bucket.

properties.name: acl
properties.description: (Optional) The canned ACL to apply. Defaults to "private".

properties.name: policy
properties.description: (Optional) A valid bucket policy JSON document. Note that if the policy document is not specific enough (but still valid), Terraform may view the policy as constantly changing in a terraform plan. In this case, please make sure you use the verbose/specific version of the policy.

properties.name: force_destroy
properties.description: (Optional, Default:false ) A boolean that indicates all objects should be deleted from the bucket so that the bucket can be destroyed without error. These objects are not recoverable.

properties.name: website
properties.description: (Optional) A website object (documented below).

properties.name: cors_rule
properties.description: (Optional) A rule of Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (documented below).

properties.name: versioning
properties.description: (Optional) A state of versioning (documented below)

properties.name: logging
properties.description: (Optional) A settings of bucket logging (documented below).

properties.name: lifecycle_rule
properties.description: (Optional) A configuration of object lifecycle management (documented below).

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Optional) If specified, the AWS region this bucket should reside in. Otherwise, the region used by the callee.
The website object supports the following:

properties.name: index_document
properties.description: (Required, unless using redirect_all_requests_to) Amazon S3 returns this index document when requests are made to the root domain or any of the subfolders.

properties.name: error_document
properties.description: (Optional) An absolute path to the document to return in case of a 4XX error.

properties.name: redirect_all_requests_to
properties.description: (Optional) A hostname to redirect all website requests for this bucket to. Hostname can optionally be prefixed with a protocol (http:// or https://) to use when redirecting requests. The default is the protocol that is used in the original request.

properties.name: routing_rules
properties.description: (Optional) A json array containing routing rules describing redirect behavior and when redirects are applied.
The CORS object supports the following:

properties.name: allowed_headers
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies which headers are allowed.

properties.name: allowed_methods
properties.description: (Required) Specifies which methods are allowed. Can be GET, PUT, POST, DELETE or HEAD.

properties.name: allowed_origins
properties.description: (Required) Specifies which origins are allowed.

properties.name: expose_headers
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies expose header in the response.

properties.name: max_age_seconds
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies time in seconds that browser can cache the response for a preflight request.
The versioning object supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Enable versioning. Once you version-enable a bucket, it can never return to an unversioned state. You can, however, suspend versioning on that bucket.

properties.name: mfa_delete
properties.description: (Optional) Enable MFA delete for either Change the versioning state of your bucket or Permanently delete an object version. Default is false.
The logging object supports the following:

properties.name: target_bucket
properties.description: (Required) The name of the bucket that will receive the log objects.

properties.name: target_prefix
properties.description: (Optional) To specify a key prefix for log objects.
The lifecycle_rule object supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Optional) Unique identifier for the rule.

properties.name: prefix
properties.description: (Optional) Object key prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Specifies lifecycle rule status.

properties.name: abort_incomplete_multipart_upload_days
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the number of days after initiating a multipart upload when the multipart upload must be completed.

properties.name: expiration
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a period in the object's expire (documented below).

properties.name: noncurrent_version_expiration
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies when noncurrent object versions expire (documented below).
At least one of expiration, noncurrent_version_expiration must be specified.
The expiration object supports the following

properties.name: date
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the date after which you want the corresponding action to take effect.

properties.name: days
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the number of days after object creation when the specific rule action takes effect.

properties.name: expired_object_delete_marker
properties.description: (Optional) On a versioned bucket (versioning-enabled or versioning-suspended bucket), you can add this element in the lifecycle configuration to direct Amazon S3 to delete expired object delete markers.
The noncurrent_version_expiration object supports the following

properties.name: days
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the number of days an object is noncurrent object versions expire.
The rules object supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Optional) Unique identifier for the rule.

properties.name: destination
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the destination for the rule (documented below).

properties.name: prefix
properties.description: (Required) Object keyname prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies. Set as an empty string to replicate the whole bucket.

properties.name: status
properties.description: (Required) The status of the rule. Either Enabled or Disabled. The rule is ignored if status is not Enabled.
The destination object supports the following:

properties.name: bucket
properties.description: (Required) The ARN of the S3 bucket where you want Amazon S3 to store replicas of the object identified by the rule.

properties.name: storage_class
properties.description: (Optional) The class of storage used to store the object.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: bucket
properties.description: (Required) The name of the bucket to which to apply the policy.

properties.name: policy
properties.description: (Required) The text of the policy.
Note: If you specify content_encoding you are responsible for encoding the body appropriately (i.e. source and content both expect already encoded/compressed bytes)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: bucket
properties.description: (Required) The name of the bucket to put the file in.

properties.name: key
properties.description: (Required) The name of the object once it is in the bucket.

properties.name: source
properties.description: (Required) The path to the source file being uploaded to the bucket.

properties.name: content
properties.description: (Required unless source given) The literal content being uploaded to the bucket.

properties.name: acl
properties.description: (Optional) The canned ACL to apply. Defaults to "private".

properties.name: cache_control
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain Read w3c cache_control for further details.

properties.name: content_disposition
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies presentational information for the object. Read wc3 content_disposition for further information.

properties.name: content_encoding
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field. Read w3c content encoding for further information.

properties.name: content_language
properties.description: (Optional) The language the content is in e.g. en-US or en-GB.

properties.name: content_type
properties.description: (Optional) A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data, e.g. application/octet-stream. All Valid MIME Types are valid for this input.

properties.name: website_redirect
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a target URL for website redirect.

properties.name: etag
properties.description: (Optional) Used to trigger updates. The only meaningful value is ${md5(file("path/to/file"))}. This attribute is not compatible with kms_key_id.

properties.name: server_side_encryption
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies server-side encryption of the object in S3. Valid values are "AES256" and "aws:kms".

properties.name: sse_kms_key_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the kms key.
Either source or content must be provided to specify the bucket content. These two arguments are mutually-exclusive.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the topic to be created.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Optional) Topic display name, which is presented as the name of the email sender in an email message.

properties.name: topic_urn
properties.description: • topic_urn - (Optional) Resource identifier of a topic, which is unique.

properties.name: push_policy
properties.description: • push_policy - (Optional) Message pushing policy. 0 indicates that the message sending fails and the message is cached in the queue. 1 indicates that the failed message is discarded.

properties.name: create_time
properties.description: • create_time - (Optional) Time when the topic was created.

properties.name: update_time
properties.description: • update_time - (Optional) Time when the topic was updated.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: topic_urn
properties.description: • topic_urn - (Required) Resource identifier of a topic, which is unique.

properties.name: endpoint
properties.description: • endpoint - (Required) Message endpoint. For an HTTP subscription, the endpoint starts with http://. For an HTTPS subscription, the endpoint starts with https://. For an email subscription, the endpoint is a mail address. For an SMS message subscription, the endpoint is a phone number.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) Protocol of the message endpoint. Currently, email, sms, http, and https are supported.

properties.name: remark
properties.description: • remark - (Optional) Remark information. The remarks must be a UTF-8-coded character string containing 128 bytes.

properties.name: subscription_urn
properties.description: • subscription_urn - (Optional) Resource identifier of a subscription, which is unique.

properties.name: owner
properties.description: • owner - (Optional) Project ID of the topic creator.

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status - (Optional) Subscription status. 0 indicates that the subscription is not confirmed. 1 indicates that the subscription is confirmed. 3 indicates that the subscription is canceled.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The region in which to create the eip. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new eip.

properties.name: publicip
properties.description: • publicip - (Required) The elastic IP address object.

properties.name: bandwidth
properties.description: • bandwidth - (Required) The bandwidth object.
The publicip block supports:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The value must be a type supported by the system. Only 5_bgp supported now. Changing this creates a new eip.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Optional) The value must be a valid IP address in the available IP address segment. Changing this creates a new eip.

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: • port_id - (Optional) The port id which this eip will associate with. If the value is "" or this not specified, the eip will be in unbind state.
The bandwidth block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The bandwidth name, which is a string of 1 to 64 characters that contain letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Required) The bandwidth size. The value ranges from 1 to 300 Mbit/s.

properties.name: charge_type
properties.description: • charge_type - (Required) Whether the bandwidth is shared or exclusive. Changing this creates a new eip.

properties.name: charge_mode
properties.description: • charge_mode - (Optional) This is a reserved field. If the system supports charging by traffic and this field is specified, then you are charged by traffic for elastic IP addresses. Changing this creates a new eip.
